==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=3|rs=足06}}

# {{defn|lang=ja|sort=足06}}

====Readings====
{{ja-readings|goon=[[る]] (ru) {{non-joyo-reading}}|kanon=[[ろ]] (ro)|kun=[[じ]] (ji), [[みち]] (michi)}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ち}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=ち}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> May be cognate with {{etyl|ko|-}} {{ko-inline|길||road}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ち}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|道}}

====Suffix====
{{ja-pos|suffix|ち}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=ち|obsolete}} attaches to place names, indicating a road to that place
#: This usage has generally been replaced by ''-ji'' below.

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|じ}}
Derived as a sound shift from ''chi'' above.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|じ}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|道}}

====Suffix====
{{ja-pos|suffix|じ}}

# a [[road]], a [[street]]
#: {{ja-usex|山'''路'''、長'''路'''|やま-'''じ'''、なが-'''じ'''|a mountain '''road''', a long '''road'''}}
# attaches to place names, indicating a road to that place
#: {{ja-usex|奈良'''路'''|^なら-'''じ'''|'''Road''' to Nara}}
# attaches to a time duration, indicating a [[trip]] taking that length of time
#: {{ja-usex|四日'''路'''|よっか-'''じ'''|a '''trip''' of four days, a four-day-long '''trip'''}}

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|みち}}
Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=みち|御|tr1=mi|pos1=honorific prefix|路|tr2=chi|t2=road, street, way}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> The prefix ''mi'' was in reference to the {{m|ja|神|tr=kami||god or spirit}} of roads.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|みち|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|道}}, {{ja-l|途}}, {{ja-l|径}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|みち}}

# a [[way]], a [[street]], a [[road]], an [[alley]], a [[path]], a pass for local traffic
# a [[way]] of doing something
